question.text: Programs that include ongoing, planned events that are designed to include children must ensure that all University employees, students and volunteers who will work with children have been subject to background and sex offender registry checks.

Programs that are occasional and need a large number of volunteers may elect to adopt measures and safeguards instead of background checks. Which of the following is NOT a condition of this exception?
question.option: The measures adopted must include requirements that the volunteers be working in public places, not alone with children, and be supervised by a background-checked person.
Programs must compile the names and addresses of the volunteers prior to the event and check the names against the sex offender registry.
Volunteers must have children of their own to participate in these programs.
Volunteers must then present photo identification to be checked at the event.
Programs adopting this method must have the approval of the University Child Protection Committee.
